page.title: 03Antiquities.
page.content: In the churchyard of Towie is a six foot high stone with hierographic characters on it.In a field, north of the Don,is a 7ft high stone of unhewn granite of Druidical origin.The name of Towie Kinbattoch Parish is derived from the gaelic Tuaidh, signifying north lying land,khan for head and Battoch meaning grove.Deskry water bounds the parish on the west and the Kindie Burn separates Towie from Strathdon. Towie Castle on Gordon of Auchindoir's orders was burnt in 1751 with Alex Forbes' Lady,family & servants inside. Glenbuchat Castle is off A97. Its last Laird played a large part in Jacobite Risings. Several Pictish settlements are known to have existed in the area. There is a Pictish Earth House in the grounds of Glenkindie House(itself a fine example of a Laird's residence).
